\title{SEYFERT}
\date{Jun 05, 2021}
\release{1.3.7dev}
\author{Luca Paganin, Marco Bonici, Stefano Davini}
\newcommand{\sphinxlogo}{\vbox{}}
\renewcommand{\releasename}{Release}
\makeindex
\begin{document}

\pagestyle{empty}
\sphinxmaketitle
\pagestyle{plain}
\sphinxtableofcontents
\pagestyle{normal}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index::doc}}


\sphinxAtStartPar
SEYFERT (SurvEY FishEr foRecast Tool) is a code to perform forecast of cosmological parameters measurement for several cosmological probes. Up to now are included:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Weak Lensing

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Spectroscopic Galaxy Clustering

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Photometric Galaxy Clustering

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Void Clustering

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
The code is written in Python in a modular way. It is actually interfaced with the Boltzmann solver \sphinxhref{https://camb.readthedocs.io/en/latest/\#python-camb}{CAMB}, altough other codes can be easily added. The code can be installed executing:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n}{installer}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{sh}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\chapter{Cosmology modules}
\label{\detokenize{index:cosmology-modules}}

\section{Cosmology}
\label{\detokenize{cosmology:cosmology}}\label{\detokenize{cosmology::doc}}

\subsection{seyfert.cosmology.cosmology Module}
\label{\detokenize{cosmology:module-seyfert.cosmology.cosmology}}\label{\detokenize{cosmology:seyfert-cosmology-cosmology-module}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!seyfert.cosmology.cosmology@\spxentry{seyfert.cosmology.cosmology}}\index{seyfert.cosmology.cosmology@\spxentry{seyfert.cosmology.cosmology}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Module hosting the cosmology class and its HDF5 file\sphinxhyphen{}interface.
The Cosmology possesses cosmological parameters values and it can compute all relevant cosmological functions, like the
Hubble parameter and the co\sphinxhyphen{}moving distance. For now accepted cosmological parameters are:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\(w_0\), CPL dark energy equation of state intercept

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\(w_a\), CPL dark energy equation of state slope

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\(h\), the dimensionless Hubble constant

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\(\sum m_{\nu}\), the sum of the neutrino mass eigenstates

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\(\sigma_8\)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\(n_s\), the scalar spectral index

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\(\Omega_m\), the cold matter density parameter

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\(\Omega_b\), the baryon density parameter

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\(\Omega_{\rm DE}\), the dark energy density parameter

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Class for managing the cosmology.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{params}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Optional}}{[}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Dict}}{[}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{str}}, {\hyperref[\detokenize{api/seyfert.cosmology.parameter.PhysicalParameter:seyfert.cosmology.parameter.PhysicalParameter}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PhysicalParameter}}}}}{]}{]}) \textendash{} a dictionary with the cosmological parameters, stored as {\hyperref[\detokenize{api/seyfert.cosmology.parameter.PhysicalParameter:seyfert.cosmology.parameter.PhysicalParameter}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PhysicalParameter}}}}} instances.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{z\_grid}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Optional}}{[}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ndarray}}{]}) \textendash{} a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{np.ndarray}} storing the redshift grid on which to compute functions.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{dimensionless\_hubble\_array}} \textendash{} a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{np.ndarray}} storing the values of the dimensionless Hubble parameter
\(E(z)\) sampled on the grid.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{dimensionless\_comoving\_distance\_array}} \textendash{} a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{np.ndarray}} storing the values of the comoving distance
\(r(z)\) sampled on the grid.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{power\_spectrum}} \textendash{} the matter power spectrum, instance of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PowerSpectrum}}.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\index{computeDimensionlessComovingDistance() (seyfert.cosmology.cosmology.Cosmology method)@\spxentry{computeDimensionlessComovingDistance()}\spxextra{seyfert.cosmology.cosmology.Cosmology method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/seyfert.cosmology.cosmology.Cosmology:seyfert.cosmology.cosmology.Cosmology.computeDimensionlessComovingDistance}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{computeDimensionlessComovingDistance}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{z}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Method to compute the dimensionless comoving distance at a given redshift, computed according the formula:
\begin{quote}
\begin{equation*}
\begin{split}\tilde{r}(z) = \int_{0}^{z} \frac{dz}{E(z)}\end{split}
\end{equation*}\end{quote}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{z}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Union}}{[}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{float}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ndarray}}{]}) \textendash{} the value of the redshift at which to compute the comoving distance

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Union}}{[}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{float}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ndarray}}{]}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
the value of the comoving distance at the given redshift(s) z

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\paragraph{PowerSpectrum}
\label{\detokenize{api/seyfert.cosmology.power_spectrum.PowerSpectrum:powerspectrum}}\label{\detokenize{api/seyfert.cosmology.power_spectrum.PowerSpectrum::doc}}\index{PowerSpectrum (class in seyfert.cosmology.power\_spectrum)@\spxentry{PowerSpectrum}\spxextra{class in seyfert.cosmology.power\_spectrum}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/seyfert.cosmology.power_spectrum.PowerSpectrum:seyfert.cosmology.power_spectrum.PowerSpectrum}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{seyfert.cosmology.power\_spectrum.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{PowerSpectrum}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{power\_spectrum\_config}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{cosmo\_pars}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}
\begin{description}
\item[{Class to manage the matter power spectrum. It can be used to calculate the linear and non linear power spectra,}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
using a given boltzmann code (e.g. CAMB), or as a container storing all the relevant information about the matter
power spectrum. In order to compute the power spectra an instance the class \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ExternalBoltzmannSolver}} is
used. Methods for doing file I/O are present, and the file format employed is HDF5 (.h5), since it allows to store
binary data with high compression options.

\end{description}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{k\_grid}} \textendash{} the wavenumber grid over which the power spectra are evaluated

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{z\_grid}} \textendash{} the redshift grid over which the power spectra are evaluated

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{lin\_p\_mm\_z\_k}} \textendash{} the linear matter power spectrum

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{nonlin\_p\_mm\_z\_k}} \textendash{} the nonlinear matter power spectrum

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\endfirsthead

&
\sphinxAtStartPar
Returns the growth factor from the linear matter power spectrum as D(z) = Plin(z, k\_min) / Plin(0, k\_min).

\subsubsection*{Attributes Documentation}
\index{growth\_factor\_z (seyfert.cosmology.power\_spectrum.PowerSpectrum attribute)@\spxentry{growth\_factor\_z}\spxextra{seyfert.cosmology.power\_spectrum.PowerSpectrum attribute}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/seyfert.cosmology.power_spectrum.PowerSpectrum:seyfert.cosmology.power_spectrum.PowerSpectrum.growth_factor_z}}\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{growth\_factor\_z}}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Returns the growth factor from the linear matter power spectrum as D(z) = Plin(z, k\_min) / Plin(0, k\_min).
The scale dependency of the growth is not taken into account.
:rtype: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ndarray}}
:return: np.ndarray

\end{fulllineitems}

\section{Redshift Density}
\label{\detokenize{redshift_density:redshift-density}}\label{\detokenize{redshift_density::doc}}

\subsection{seyfert.cosmology.redshift\_density Module}
\label{\detokenize{redshift_density:module-seyfert.cosmology.redshift_density}}\label{\detokenize{redshift_density:seyfert-cosmology-redshift-density-module}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!seyfert.cosmology.redshift\_density@\spxentry{seyfert.cosmology.redshift\_density}}\index{seyfert.cosmology.redshift\_density@\spxentry{seyfert.cosmology.redshift\_density}!module@\spxentry{module}}

\paragraph{Bias}
\label{\detokenize{api/seyfert.cosmology.bias.Bias:bias}}\label{\detokenize{api/seyfert.cosmology.bias.Bias::doc}}\index{Bias (class in seyfert.cosmology.bias)@\spxentry{Bias}\spxextra{class in seyfert.cosmology.bias}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/seyfert.cosmology.bias.Bias:seyfert.cosmology.bias.Bias}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{seyfert.cosmology.bias.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{Bias}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{probe}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{z\_bin\_edges}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Class managing the bias.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{model}} \textendash{} instance of {\hyperref[\detokenize{api/seyfert.cosmology.bias.BiasModel:seyfert.cosmology.bias.BiasModel}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{BiasModel}}}}}. It defines the model with which to compute the
bias as a function of the redshift.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{nuisance\_parameters}} \textendash{} a Dict{[}str, float{]} of nuisance parameters for the bias. It should contain the updated
values of the nuisance parameters, since these may be let free to vary.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{additional\_parameters}} \textendash{} a Dict{[}str, float{]} of additional parameters for the bias. These are kept constant and not
let free to vary as it happens for nuisance parameters

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\paragraph{AngularCoefficient}
\label{\detokenize{api/seyfert.cosmology.c_ells.AngularCoefficient:angularcoefficient}}\label{\detokenize{api/seyfert.cosmology.c_ells.AngularCoefficient::doc}}\index{AngularCoefficient (class in seyfert.cosmology.c\_ells)@\spxentry{AngularCoefficient}\spxextra{class in seyfert.cosmology.c\_ells}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/seyfert.cosmology.c_ells.AngularCoefficient:seyfert.cosmology.c_ells.AngularCoefficient}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{seyfert.cosmology.c\_ells.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{AngularCoefficient}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{probe1}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{probe2}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{kernel}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{forecast\_config}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{angular\_config}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{full\_output}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Class representing a particular kind of angular power spectrum (i.e. auto\sphinxhyphen{}correlation or cross\sphinxhyphen{}correlation.
These are computed in the Limber approximation, meaning that a single redshift integral is performed.
Attributes
———\sphinxhyphen{}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{c\_lij}} \textendash{} np 3D array (l, i, j) storing the values of the Cl tomographic matrix. Here l is the multipole

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{l\_bin\_centers}} \textendash{} the multipole bin centers where to compute the Cl, np 1D array.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{l\_bin\_widths}} \textendash{} the multipole bin widths, np 1D array.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{limber\_power\_spectrum\_l\_z}} \textendash{} np 2D array (l, z) storing the matter power spectrum evaluated in the Limber
approximation, i.e. at wave\sphinxhyphen{}numbers \(k = \frac{l+1/2}{r(z)}\). The redshift dimension is define by the
redshift grid

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{cosmology}} \textendash{} instance of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Cosmology}} class storing the current cosmology.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{angular\_config}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Optional}}{[}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AngularConfig}}{]}) \textendash{} configuration for the Cl computation, instance of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AngularConfig}}.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{forecast\_config}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Optional}}{[}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ForecastConfig}}{]}) \textendash{} forecast configuration, instance of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ForecastConfig}}.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{kernel}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Optional}}{[}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{KernelFunction}}{]}) \textendash{} kernel function to be integrated against the Limber power spectrum, instance of
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{KernelFunction}}.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}
